text:
Raskolnikov's Dilemma

Dim room, tension thickens.  
Raskolnikov: “If she knew the watch was lost...”  

Razumihin: “Not at all! I didn’t mean that!”  

Raskolnikov (thinking): “Did I overdo it?”  

---

Calm, cold demeanor from Porfiry.  
Porfiry: “Your things wouldn’t be lost.”  

Raskolnikov (shuddering): “Why is he expecting me?”  

Razumihin: “Did you know he had pledges?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels anxious and self-conscious during a conversation with Porfiry and Razumihin about a lost watch and his mother's presence.
